subject: Sleep
title: Nap Pods at Work
description: One-minute skill: Nap Pods at Work.

hook.text: Google installed nap pods in their offices. Then Nike, Samsung, and NASA followed. The workplace nap is going mainstream.

buildup.text: A 20-minute nap improves alertness, mood, and performance more effectively than caffeine.

discovery.text: NASA found that a 26-minute nap improved pilot performance by 34 percent and alertness by 54 percent.

twist.text: Despite the evidence, most companies still view napping as laziness. Cultural stigma lags behind the science.

climax.text: The companies that embrace napping report higher productivity, fewer errors, and better employee retention.

punchline.text: The most productive thing you can do at 2 PM might be close your eyes.

quiz.question: By how much did NASA find a 26-minute nap improved pilot performance?
